Row.Text: [COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]You must unlock {1_Num} Policies from other Branches before this Branch becomes unlocked.[ENDCOLOR]

Your Current [ICON_VP_SPY_POINTS] Spy Points: {1_Num}/{2_Threshold}[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]You gain a new Spy whenever the number of [ICON_VP_SPY_POINTS] Spy Points exceeds the threshold of {2_Threshold}. The threshold value scales on the number of Civilizations and City-States existing at the start of the game. When the first Civilization reaches Renaissance, or when you reach any later Era, you gain 100 [ICON_VP_SPY_POINTS] Spy Points. Some Buildings and Policies also provide [ICON_VP_SPY_POINTS] Spy Points.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Total Number of [ICON_VP_SPY_POINTS] Spy Points ever accumulated: {3_NumTotal}
[NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] No Great Works in City to steal.
[NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] Spy is not high enough Rank for this choice.
[NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] City is not producing enough Faith to steal.
[NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] City not producing enough of this yield to siphon.
Once {1_Rank} {2_Spy} has arrived in {3_City}, they will start collecting Network Points. Network Points unlock passive bonuses while the spy is in the city, or can be spend to perform Spy Missions.
View the passive bonuses {1_Rank} {2_Spy} has unlocked while gathering intelligence in {3_City}, or choose to spend Network Points to perform a Spy Mission.
Your spy has collected [COLOR_CYAN]{1_Num} Network Points[ENDCOLOR]. This has unlocked the following passive bonuses:[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]{2_PassiveBonuses}

The highest number of Network Points once collected by your spy during their stay in this city is [COLOR_CYAN]{1_Num}[ENDCOLOR]. This has unlocked the following passive bonuses:[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]{2_PassiveBonuses}
Your spy has collected [COLOR_CYAN]{1_Num} Network Points[ENDCOLOR] so far. Keep the spy in the city to collect more Network Points and unlock passive bonuses.
You need to have collected at least {1_Num} Network Points to view the city screen.

You can have your spy conduct a Spy Mission if the mission requirements are met. Conducting a mission [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]costs Network Points[ENDCOLOR], and there is a chance that your spy is [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]identified[ENDCOLOR], resulting in worsened diplomatic relations. The spy can also be [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]killed[ENDCOLOR], in which case the mission is still carried out, but it will take some time before a replacement spy is recruited.
Select a new focus for {1_Rank} {2_Spy}. After doing so, you cannot move the spy or change focus again for {3_NumTurns} {3_NumTurns: plural 1?turn; other?turns;}.
Once {1_Rank} {2_Spy} has arrived in {3_City}, you can select a counterspy focus.
{1_Rank} {2_Spy} is permanently assigned as a diplomat to the capital of {3_Civ} and cannot be moved anywhere else.
Because you recently selected a new counterspy focus, {1_Rank} {2_Spy} cannot move for {3_NumTurns} more {3_NumTurns: plural 1?turn; other?turns;}.
Because you recently selected a new counterspy focus, {1_Rank} {2_Spy} cannot change focus again for {3_NumTurns} more {3_NumTurns: plural 1?turn; other?turns;}.
This is the currently active Focus.
View unlocked passive bonuses and access intelligence information gathered by {1_Rank} {2_Spy} [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT][ENDCOLOR]

Once {1_Rank} {2_Spy} has arrived in {3_City}, they will start collecting Network Points. Network Points unlock passive bonuses and grant access to intelligence information about the other civilization while {1_Rank} {2_Spy} is schmoozing as a Diplomat in the city.
Your diplomat has collected [COLOR_CYAN]{1_Num} Network Points[ENDCOLOR]. This has unlocked the following bonuses:[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]{2_PassiveBonuses}
You need to have collected at least {1_Num} Network Points to view the tech screen.
You need to have collected at least {1_Num} Network Points to view the policy screen.
You need to have collected at least {1_Num} Network Points to view the list of the military units.
You need to have collected at least {1_Num} Network Points to view the active trade deals.

You currently refuse to receive [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence from completing Quests for [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_Name}[ENDCOLOR]. You may change your stance and allow [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence to be rewarded again for completing Quests.

You may reject the [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence from completing Quests for [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_Name}[ENDCOLOR]. This attempts to avoid political repercussions from other civilizations when they see you competing for the [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence of this City-State.

If this City-State is more [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]afraid[ENDCOLOR] of you than they are [COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]resilient[ENDCOLOR], you can take heavy tribute from them. Doing so will net you [ICON_GOLD] Gold as well as the non-influence yields of all active personal quests from the City-States. The quests will then be canceled.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]{1_FearLevel}{2_FactorDetails}
These Civilizations have invested Resting [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence in [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_Name}[ENDCOLOR]:
No one has invested Resting [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence in [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_Name}[ENDCOLOR].
You are receiving [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_Num} [ICON_GOLD] Gold[ENDCOLOR] per turn from them.
If this City-State is more [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]afraid[ENDCOLOR] of you than they are [COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]resilient[ENDCOLOR], you can annex the City-State. {1_FearLevel}{2_FactorDetails}
Are you sure you want to forcefully annex {1_MinorCivName:textkey}?
{1_CivName:textkey} {1_CivName: plural 1?is; other?are;} their current Ally. Until their [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Sphere of Influence[ENDCOLOR] is removed, you cannot remove them from this position.
Because there is an active [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Open Door Policy[ENDCOLOR] in effect here, no one can become this City-State's Ally.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Diplomatic Marriage:[ENDCOLOR] Your [ICON_INFLUENCE] Resting Influence is increased by 75, scaling with Era, and you gain +15% [ICON_GREAT_PEOPLE] Great Person Rate in your [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital.
These players have pledged to protect this City State. Attacking this City State and/or befriending them may incur the wrath of these players.
They give you a piece of treasured art, a gift worth [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_NumCulture} [ICON_CULTURE] Culture[ENDCOLOR].
You are the first outsiders they have met, so they show you their treasured religious idols. You gain [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_NumFaith} [ICON_PEACE] Faith[ENDCOLOR].
You are the first great empire they have met, so they provide you a gift of [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_NumGold} [ICON_GOLD] Gold[ENDCOLOR].
You arrived just in time for their annual harvest festival. They gave you a cart filled with [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_NumFood} [ICON_FOOD] Food[ENDCOLOR].
They share their knowledge of artistic merit, giving you [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_NumCulture} [ICON_CULTURE] Culture[ENDCOLOR].
They share their knowledge of religious rituals, giving you [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_NumFaith} [ICON_PEACE] Faith[ENDCOLOR].
They provide you with a gift of [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_NumGold} [ICON_GOLD] Gold[ENDCOLOR].
They provide you with a crate of [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_NumFood} [ICON_FOOD] Food[ENDCOLOR].
Unfortunately, they have nothing to offer you.
Unfortunately, they have nothing to offer you, but as {2: gender *:an?an; other?a;} {2_Personality} City State your [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]friendship increases by {1_NumFriendship}[ENDCOLOR].
They want you to declare war on {1_TargetName:textkey}.
They want you to build the {1_NationalWonderName:textkey}.
They want you to send them {TXT_KEY_GRAMMAR_A_AN << {1_UnitName}} with at least {2_XP} XP.
They want you to find the City-State of {1_CityStateName:textkey}.
Diplomatic Missions are temporarily more effective.
They will reward the player with the highest [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism per turn.
{TXT_KEY_CITY_STATE_QUEST_INFLUENCE_TOURISM_FORMAL} So far, you have the lead with [ICON_TOURISM] [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_PlayerScore} per turn[ENDCOLOR].
{TXT_KEY_CITY_STATE_QUEST_INFLUENCE_TOURISM_FORMAL} So far, the leader has [ICON_TOURISM] {1_LeaderScore} per turn and you have [ICON_TOURISM] [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{2_PlayerScore} per turn[ENDCOLOR].
Send an archaeologist to a site near this city-state.
Be the first to circumnavigate the world.
They want you to liberate the city of {1_CityName:textkey}.
Protect them from a barbarian horde! If there are barbarians next to the city when the quest ends, the city will be [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]sacked[ENDCOLOR]!
A revolution against their ally is occurring!
Rearrange owned Great Works into potential Themes. Does not swap Great Works with other Civilizations and removes any Great Works already up for trade.
Rearrange Great Works into potential Themes. Swaps Great Works with other Civilizations and may put excess Great Works up for trade (if needed).
Influenced by the number of civilizations not following our Ideology:
Influence due to only recently adopting/switching Ideologies:
{1_Num} [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism from {2_Num}% of the [ICON_CULTURE] Culture of your [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital
[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Modifier for Holy City of the World Religion: {1_Num}%
{1_Num}% Penalty from lack of Trade Routes (Sakoku)[NEWLINE]
+{1_Num}% Bonus from your Corporate Franchises in their Empire[NEWLINE]

[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_CYAN]Influence Benefits:[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Trade Routes to this Civ Generate:[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+5%[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_FOOD] Growth in Origin City[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+2[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_GOLD] Gold[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+2[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_RESEARCH] Science[NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Espionage Bonuses versus this Civ:[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] [ICON_SPY] Spies Establish Surveillance in [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]5[ENDCOLOR] turns[NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]City Conquest Bonuses versus this Civ:[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]-15%[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_RESISTANCE] Unrest Time[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]-15%[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizen loss from City conquest

20% of [ICON_CULTURE] Culture generated per turn and instant yields of [ICON_CULTURE] Culture gained in the prior 10 turns influences the amount of [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism generated from [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Historic Events[ENDCOLOR].

[ICON_TOURISM] Tourism generated per turn and instant yields of [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism gained in the prior 10 turns influences the amount of Tourism generated from [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Historic Events[ENDCOLOR].
This is how many [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Historic Events[ENDCOLOR] you have accomplished with your Civilization in total of all types!
This is the list of [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Historic Events[ENDCOLOR] available for you to achieve. You can unlock some more through Buildings or Social Policies.
This is the amount of [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism you will generate from this [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Historic Event[ENDCOLOR] to all known Civilizations unless stated otherwise!
Each [ICON_RESEARCH] Era you advance to will be a [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Historic Event[ENDCOLOR]!
Each [ICON_WONDER] World Wonders you finish will be a [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Historic Event[ENDCOLOR]!
Each [ICON_GREAT_PEOPLE] Great Person born in your Civilization will be a [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Historic Event[ENDCOLOR]!
Each [ICON_PEACE] favorable peace treaty ([COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]War Score 25+[ENDCOLOR]) you complete will be a [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Historic Event[ENDCOLOR]!
Each [ICON_GOLDEN_AGE] Golden Age you enter will be a [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Historic Event[ENDCOLOR]!
Each [ICON_RES_ARTIFACTS] Antiquity Site excavated will be a [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Historic Event[ENDCOLOR]!

Each [ICON_CARAVAN] Land Trade Route completed from [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_Name}[ENDCOLOR] to another foreign Major City will be a [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Historic Event[ENDCOLOR]! The amount here will be sent toward the targeted Major Civilization and one-third of the amount will be sent to every other Civilizations.

Each [ICON_CARGO_SHIP] Sea Trade Route completed from [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_Name}[ENDCOLOR] to another foreign Major City will be a [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Historic Event[ENDCOLOR]! The amount here will be sent toward the targeted Major Civilization and one-third of the amount will be sent to every other Civilizations.

Each [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade Route completed either by land or sea with a [ICON_CITY_STATE] City-State will be a [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Historic Event[ENDCOLOR]! Unlike trading with a foreign Major City, this amount will be the same sent to all Civilizations.
[ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]-{1_Num}%[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_RESEARCH] cost for technologies known to other civilizations.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Tech unlocks remaining until free Social Policy: {1_Num}[ENDCOLOR]
[ICON_BULLET]{1_Num} is added per turn from [ICON_RELIGION] Religion
[ICON_BULLET]{1_Num} is added per turn from [ICON_GREAT_PEOPLE] Traits
[ICON_BULLET]{1_Num} is added per turn from [ICON_CAPITAL] Cities
{1_Num} from Local Sources in Cities (Religion, Buildings, etc).
{1_Num} from Imported and Controlled Luxuries (Avg. {2_Num} per Luxury).

Total [ICON_HAPPINESS_3] Unhappiness Value from Empire Sources is split across all cities evenly, with any remainder divided up amongst your cities, starting with the Capital and progressing from oldest to newest (in terms of founding).

Total [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness Value from Empire Sources is split across all cities evenly, with any remainder divided up amongst your cities, starting with the Capital and progressing from oldest to newest (in terms of founding).
Your approval rating is less than 35% - your Empire is in open rebellion! Cities may abandon your Empire and flip to the Civilization that is most culturally influential over your people!
Your approval rating is less than 20% - your Empire is fracturing! Cities will rapidly abandon your Empire and flip to the Civilization that is most culturally influential over your people!
[ICON_FOOD] Growth is reduced by {1_NumGrowth}% in all Cities and Settler costs are increased by {2_NumSettlerCost}%! [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat effectiveness is also reduced by {3_NumCombatStrength}%!
Reduced due to your current wars
Reduced from number of known Techs

Number of Military Units: {12_Num} ({2_Num} Military Supply Used)[NEWLINE]Total Military Supply: {1_Num}[NEWLINE][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]War Weariness Supply Cap Reduction: {6_Num}%[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Military Supply Values:[NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET]+{4_Num} from [ICON_CITY_STATE] Cities ([ICON_WAR] {13_Num} - {14_Num} from [ICON_RESEARCH] Tech Maintenance)[NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET]+{3_Num} from [ICON_CITIZEN] Population ([ICON_SILVER_FIST] {15_Num} - {16_Num} from [ICON_RESEARCH] Tech Maintenance)[NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET]+{5_Num} from [ICON_CHECKBOX] Difficulty Level ([ICON_CAPITAL] {17_Num} - {18_Num} from [ICON_RESEARCH] Era Level)[NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET]+{11_Num} from [ICON_GREAT_GENERAL]/[ICON_GREAT_ADMIRAL] Great People[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Military Supply Reductions:[NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] -{8_Num} from [ICON_RESEARCH] Total Tech Level[NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] -{9_Num} from [ICON_CITY_STATE] Empire Size[NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] -{7_Num} from [ICON_WAR] War Weariness[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Military Unit [ICON_GOLD]/[ICON_PEACE] Costs increased by {10_Num}% due to [ICON_WAR] War Weariness.
Total: {1_Num} [ICON_CULTURE] Culture (due to [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence over this City-State)
{1_CivName} {1_CivName: plural 1?has; other?have;} unlocked {2_Num} more {2_Num: plural 1?Policy; other?Policies;} than you.
You have unlocked {1_Num} more {1_Num: plural 1?Policy; other?Policies;} than {2_CivName}.
Total: {1_Num} [ICON_RESEARCH] Science (due to [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence over this City-State)
Total: {1_Num} [ICON_FOOD] Food (from Feitoria).[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]These values are modified by your relationship status (Neutral/Friend/Ally) with the City-State.
+{2_Num} [ICON_GOLD] Gold due to your Cultural Influence over {1_CivName}
+{2_Num} [ICON_GOLD] Gold due to the Cultural Influence of {1_CivName} over you

Cannot construct a Franchise here for one of the following reasons:[NEWLINE]- Reached Franchise maximum[NEWLINE]- You or other player are sanctioned by the World Congress[NEWLINE]- You or other player have adopted Tenets that prevent the creation of Franchises in foreign cities
Click to sort by the amount of [ICON_CULTURE] Culture that the destination city would receive from this trade route.
Click to sort by the amount of [ICON_CULTURE] Culture that the civilization that established the trade route generates from this trade route.
Click to sort by the maximum [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Range[ENDCOLOR] of trade routes originating from this City.
Click to sort by the normalized [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Length[ENDCOLOR] of this trade route.
Click to sort by the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Turns[ENDCOLOR] to complete this trade route.
Click to initiate this trade route.
You need to have an eligible Trade Unit selected to be able to send trade routes from this screen.
Click to relocate this Trade Unit to this City.
The number of times you can use the Fleet Repair ability. At zero, the unit is consumed.
This indicates the length of a Concert Tour. The length is based on number of owned Great Works of Music controlled by the owning Civilization.
Deleting units is disabled in this game.
You cannot delete a unit when there are enemies nearby.
Allows the sale of world maps to other civilizations.
Allows technology to be sold to other civilizations.
Allows you to make rival civilizations your vassal state.
[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]"We Love the Empress Day" Modifier: +{1_Num}% [ICON_FOOD] Growth
[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]City Modifier from Water Blockade (Enemy Naval Units adjacent to City): {1_Num}%
This City is in "We Love the Empress Day", which increases the City's [ICON_FOOD] Growth modifier!
Connecting this Resource to your trade network will cause this City to go into "We Love the Empress Day."
This City is celebrating Carnival, which increases [ICON_FOOD] Growth and reduces [ICON_HAPPINESS_3] Unhappiness!
Connecting this Resource to your trade network will cause this City to celebrate Carnival, which increases [ICON_FOOD] Growth and reduces [ICON_HAPPINESS_3] Unhappiness!
Because of an enemy Spy Mission, the city is blockaded and cannot perform ranged strikes for [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_Turns}[ENDCOLOR] {1_Turns: plural 1?Turn; other?Turns;}.

Enemy Naval Units and Embarked Units expend all [ICON_MOVES] Movement when entering water territory owned by this City. Units ending their turn in Ocean tiles owned by this City take [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]5 Damage[ENDCOLOR].
Enemy Land Units expend all [ICON_MOVES] Movement when entering land territory owned by this City.
Enemy Naval Units and Embarked Units expend all [ICON_MOVES] Movement when entering water territory owned by this City.
Allows [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Airlifts[ENDCOLOR] to or from this City. Increased Air Unit Capacity of the City. +10 [ICON_STRENGTH] Damage to Enemy Air Units during Air Strikes on the City.
City has an [ICON_INDUSTRIAL_CONNECTED] Industrial City Connection with the [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital!

Capturing [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_Name}[ENDCOLOR] will always result in the destruction of the Headquarters, closing all active Offices and Franchises but permits others to rebuild its Headquarters once more.

A completed [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade Route from or to [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_Name}[ENDCOLOR] will attempt to establish a [ICON_VP_FRANCHISE] [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Franchise[ENDCOLOR] in foreign cities.
A conquered [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Cultured[ENDCOLOR] City-State will provide you gifts of [ICON_CULTURE] Culture, allowing you to obtain Social Policies more quickly.
A conquered [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Militaristic[ENDCOLOR] City-State will provide you occasional gifts of advanced military units.

A conquered [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Militaristic[ENDCOLOR] City-State will provide you occasional gifts of advanced military units.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]They know the secrets of the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{@1_UniqueUnitName}[ENDCOLOR]. If you have researched [COLOR_CYAN]{@2_PrereqTech}[ENDCOLOR], they will provide that unit as their gift.
A conquered [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Maritime[ENDCOLOR] City-State will boost the [ICON_FOOD] Food of your [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital greatly, and all of your cities.

A conquered [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Mercantile[ENDCOLOR] City-State will provide extra [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness in your empire, and manufactures special luxury resources which cannot be acquired any other way.
A conquered [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Religious[ENDCOLOR] City-State will increase your [ICON_PEACE] Faith, allowing you to empower your religion with new beliefs and units.
[NEWLINE]{1_BuildingName:textkey} cannot be constructed while you are constructing {2_BuildingName:textkey} elsewhere in your Empire.
[NEWLINE]Blocked because of recent Spy Mission ({1_Num} {1_Num: plural 1?Turn; other?Turns;} remaining).
Click here to have the governor reassign specialists.

This City was formerly owned by [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{@1_PlayerName}[ENDCOLOR]. [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Due to past hostile actions committed against them, you do not have the opportunity to return it to them.[ENDCOLOR]

This City was formerly owned by [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{@1_PlayerName}[ENDCOLOR]. [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Because you have chosen not to liberate them, you do not have the opportunity to return this city to them.[ENDCOLOR]

Cities cannot produce more [ICON_HAPPINESS_3] Unhappiness than their [ICON_CITIZEN] Population (except from [ICON_URBANIZATION] Urbanization).[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Local [ICON_HAPPINESS_3] Unhappiness: [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]{1_NUM}[ENDCOLOR] (Turn {2_NUM})

[ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]{1_Num}[ENDCOLOR] from [ICON_FOOD] and [ICON_PRODUCTION] Distress[NEWLINE] Actual: {3_Num} [ICON_HAPPINESS_3] (Reduced by {4_Num})[NEWLINE] Total Deficit: [COLOR_CYAN]{2_Num:number "#.##"}[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_FOOD]/[ICON_PRODUCTION][NEWLINE] Increase [ICON_FOOD]/[ICON_PRODUCTION] by {5_Num:number "#.##"} for -1 [ICON_HAPPINESS_3]

[ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]{1_Num}[ENDCOLOR] from [ICON_GOLD] Poverty[NEWLINE] Actual: {3_Num} [ICON_HAPPINESS_3] (Reduced by {4_Num})[NEWLINE] Total Deficit: [COLOR_CYAN]{2_Num:number "#.##"} [ICON_GOLD][ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE] Increase [ICON_GOLD] by {5_Num:number "#.##"} for -1 [ICON_HAPPINESS_3]

[ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]{1_Num}[ENDCOLOR] from [ICON_RESEARCH] Illiteracy[NEWLINE] Actual: {3_Num} [ICON_HAPPINESS_3] (Reduced by {4_Num})[NEWLINE] Total Deficit: [COLOR_CYAN]{2_Num:number "#.##"} [ICON_RESEARCH][ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE] Increase [ICON_RESEARCH] by {5_Num:number "#.##"} for -1 [ICON_HAPPINESS_3]

[ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]{1_Num}[ENDCOLOR] from [ICON_CULTURE] Boredom[NEWLINE] Actual: {3_Num} [ICON_HAPPINESS_3] (Reduced by {4_Num})[NEWLINE] Total Deficit: [COLOR_CYAN]{2_Num:number "#.##"} [ICON_CULTURE][ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE] Increase [ICON_CULTURE] by {5_Num:number "#.##"} for -1 [ICON_HAPPINESS_3]
[ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]{1_Num}[ENDCOLOR] from Religious Unrest[NEWLINE] Reduction: {3_Num}, Needs {2_Icon} Followers

[ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]{1_Num}[ENDCOLOR] from Isolation.[NEWLINE] ([ICON_BLOCKADED] Blockaded / no [ICON_CONNECTED] Connection /[NEWLINE] no [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade Route)
[COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]({1_Num})[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_CITIZEN_RED]: "[ICON_WAR] War! What is it good for!?"
Cities CAN produce more [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness than their [ICON_CITIZEN] Population.

[NEWLINE](These 'Needs' are averages of yields based on the number of [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizens in the City, as well as temporary situations, such as starvation or blockades. Averages increase as the game progresses, and yields per citizen decrease as a city grows. The bigger the divide between your city's yields and your empire-wide average, the higher your city's unhappiness!)

[ICON_PUPPET] Puppeted, [ICON_OCCUPIED] Occupied, [ICON_RAZE] Razing, or [ICON_RESISTANCE] Resistance Cities do not produce [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness or benefit from Empire-Wide [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness sources.
[NEWLINE]"If you don't drive your business, you will be driven out of business."[NEWLINE] - B.C. Forbes[NEWLINE]

Trade and commerce has been a focal point of civilization since ancient times. Corporations are modern entities that authorizes a company or single group to act as a single entity. Corporations have become the largest facilitators of trade and influence in today's society. In Civilization V, Corporations allow you cement your civilization's wealth and deliver powerful trade benefits to your civilization.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]To establish a Corporation, you must secure a Global Monopoly on any of its required resources, and found its Corporation Headquarters. After your Corporation is established, you may construct Offices in your cities and use them to build Franchises in foreign cities via [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade Routes.
[ICON_FOOD] and [ICON_PRODUCTION] Basic Needs Median in this City: {1_num}%
[ICON_FOOD] and [ICON_PRODUCTION] Basic Needs Median in all Cities: {1_num}%

[ICON_BULLET] New Religious Unrest: {1_Num} [ICON_HAPPINESS_3] per Religious Minority[NEWLINE][BULLET]Current Religious Unrest: {2_Num} [ICON_HAPPINESS_3] per Religious Minority
Additional +{1_Num}% [ICON_GREAT_PEOPLE] Great Person Rate from Corporation
Requires an Ideology to become active.
An unmet player controls another unmet civilization as a Vassal.
You are leading by controlling {1_num} original [ICON_CAPITAL] Capitals/Vassals.
An unmet player controls {1_num} original [ICON_CAPITAL] Capitals/Vassals.
The City-State of {1_Name} controls {2_Num}. They contribute the City to their Ally. Break their alliance or take the [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital from them![NEWLINE][NEWLINE]

The City-State of {1_Name} controls {2_Num}. They contribute the City to their Ally's Master. Break their alliance, liberate their ally, or take the [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital from them![NEWLINE][NEWLINE]
The City-State of {1_Name} controls {2_Num}. They have no current ally. Ally them or take the [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital from them![NEWLINE][NEWLINE]
{1_Name} controls {2_Num}. They contribute the City to their Master. Liberate them or take the [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital from them![NEWLINE][NEWLINE]

Voluntarily become the other civilization's vassal. A voluntary vassal may choose to leave their master at any time after {1_Num} turns have passed.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]WARNING: A master who accepts a voluntary vassal immediately declares war on everyone who is currently at war with that vassal. This may have serious consequences![NEWLINE][NEWLINE]If the capitulating civilization has vassals, they will be liberated.

This civilization surrenders to the other player and becomes their Vassal State. A civilization that capitulates cannot leave their master until {1_Num} turns have passed.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]If the capitulating civilization has vassals, they will be liberated.
This civilization abandons mastery over all vassals. Only valid if the player has vassals and is able to liberate them.

(Hover over Corporation Icon or Name for details.)

Global Resource Monopolies are achieved when you control over 50% of a Luxury or Strategic Resource. This value can exceed 100% if you produce more of a Resource than exists on the Map. More than one Civilization can, therefore, have a Global Monopoly (though this is quite rare).
Information on Your Corporation's Bonuses and Requirements Will Appear Here (Once Founded)
Total number of foreign Cities with Franchises (i.e. Cities your Corporation has spread to).
Total number of owned Cities with Offices in them.

Corporations are powerful, late-game entities that are only available to Civilizations with Global Resource Monopolies. For more information, see the Civilopedia Concepts section on Coroporations, and the Wonders tab.
List of Offices in owned Cities.
List of Cities your Corporation has spread to.
List of Foreign Corporations and their total worldwide Franchises.
(Right-click the Corporation Icon for more information)
Corporations are available to be established.
You are unable to establish a Corporation because every Corporation has been already established.

To found a Corporation, you must have a Global Monopoly over any of the required Resources and build the Corporation Headquarters in one of your cities. Only one Corporation is available per civilization.
Number of foreign Trade Routes from this city. After the Trade Route ends, a {1_CorpName} will be built in that city if it does not already contain a {1_CorpName} Franchise.
Your city has a Trade Route with the following foreign cities:

Spread your Corporation by sending [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade Routes from cities with Offices in them to foreign Cities. There is a chance each turn that Franchises will spawn in their Empire and, at the end of the [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade Route, you are guaranteed one new Franchise (if one does not already exist in that city).
You cannot create a Corporation until you have researched the Corporations technology.
No Franchises have been established in the World yet.
No Corporations have been established in the World yet.

Number of Vassals in the World: {1_Num}
Vassalage does not begin until you enter the Medieval Era, or become somebody's vassal.

If a vassal can declare independence, they may revoke their status of being your vassal at any time . If you refuse this request, you will declare war on your vassal. They are more likely to ask if they feel they have a good chance at succeeding in their revolution.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Your vassal may declare independence after the following conditions are satisfied:

If you can declare independence, you may revoke your status of being their vassal at any time. Be careful, as if they refuse your request, they will declare war on you. They are more likely to respect your declaration of independence if you have a strong military presence.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]You may declare independence after the following conditions are satisfied:
[TAB][ICON_BULLET]Vassal's team has {1_CityPercent}% or less of Cities when vassalage started. (currently {2_Percent})
[TAB][ICON_BULLET]Vassal's team has {1_PopPercent}% or more of Population than when vassalage started. (currently {2_Percent})

[TAB][ICON_BULLET]Vassal's team has {1_CityPercent}% or more than Master's team number of Cities (team-wide) AND {2_PopPercent}% or more than Master's team [ICON_CITIZEN] Population. (currently {3_Percent} and {4_Percent})

Ratio between the number of total cities your vassal currently possesses (team-wide) and the number of cities (team-wide) it had when it became your Vassal.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Team Number of Cities Now: {1_CurrentCities}[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Team Number of Cities When Vassal Started: {2_StartCities}[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This player currently has {3_PlayerCities} Cities.

Ratio between the total number of Cities your vassal currently possesses (team-wide) and the number of Cities your team has now.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Team Number of Vassal Cities Now: {1_CurrentCities}[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Master Team Number of Cities: {2_MasterCities}[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This player currently has {3_Cities} Cities.

Ratio between the total [ICON_CITIZEN] Population your vassal currently possesses (team-wide) and the number of [ICON_CITIZEN] Population your team has now.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Team Number of [ICON_CITIZEN] Population Now: {1_CurrentPop}[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Master Team [ICON_CITIZEN] Population: {2_MasterPop}[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This player currently has {3_PlayerPop} [ICON_CITIZEN] Population.

Ratio between the total [ICON_CITIZEN] Population your vassal currently possesses (team-wide) and the [ICON_CITIZEN] Population (team-wide) it had when it became your Vassal.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Team [ICON_CITIZEN] Population Now: {1_CurrentPop}[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Team [ICON_CITIZEN] Population When Vassal Started: {2_StartPop}[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This player currently has {3_PlayerPop} [ICON_CITIZEN] Population.

Liberate this vassal, freeing them from your control. This is a peaceful action, will not result in a war, and result in a very large diplomatic boost with your former vassal.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]After performing this action, {1_TeamName} will no longer be your vassal. You cannot undo this action.[ENDCOLOR]
You may only perform this action after you have a vassal for at least {1_Num} turns. You may liberate this vassal in {2_Num} {2_Num: plural 1?turn; other?turns;}.
Your vassal's view of how you are treating them, based on the following fields:
There have been no incidents to modify your vassal's opinion of you.

You are receiving {1_Num} [ICON_GOLD] Gold Per Turn from this vassal, based on {2_TaxRate}% of their {3_Num} [ICON_GOLD] Gross Gold Per Turn.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Taxes are divided evenly among members in your team.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Vassal tax rate is calculated at the start of the turn.

You may only apply changes to a vassal's tax rate after {1_NumTurns} turns have passed since your last adjustment.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]You may make another adjustment in {2_NumTurnsLeft} {2_NumTurnsLeft: plural 1?turn; other?turns;}.
[COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Taxes have never been set for this vassal.[ENDCOLOR]
Taxes may be changed on Turn {1_Turn}.
Apply changes to the Vassal's tax rate. The changes will take effect on the next turn.

Are you sure you want to apply a tax rate of {1_TaxRate} to {2_TeamName}? You cannot change this value for {3_NumTurns} Turns. The tax will be applied on the following turn. [COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]This action CANNOT be undone.[ENDCOLOR]
Are you sure you want to liberate {1_TeamName}? This will liberate ALL civilizations in this team from your control. [COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]This action CANNOT be undone.[ENDCOLOR]

Are you sure you want to request independence from {1_TeamName}. If refused, your civilizations will enter [COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]War[ENDCOLOR]. [COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]This action CANNOT be undone.[ENDCOLOR]

Voluntary vassals are vassals acquired through trade. It is a mutual agreement in which the vassal agrees to serve the Master in exchange for protection. Voluntary vassals can leave at any time after a brief period.

Capitulated vassals are vassals acquired as the result of being crippled in war. Capitulated vassals are completely subservient to the master and cannot leave their masters until they have satisfied a series of requirements.
There are {1_Num} vassals available to set taxes for.

Ratio between our [ICON_CITIZEN] Population and {1_MasterPlayer}'s [ICON_CITIZEN] Population.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Ratio between player [ICON_CITIZEN] Population (Ratio between team [ICON_CITIZEN] Population)
Ratio between our team's [ICON_CITIZEN] Population now and our team's [ICON_CITIZEN] Population when we became the vassal of {1_TeamName}.
Number of Our Cities (Number of Our Team Cities)
Number of Their Cities (Number of Their Team Cities)
Ratio between our Number of Cities and {1_MasterPlayer}'s Number of Cities.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Ratio between player Number of Cities (Ratio between team Number of Cities)
Ratio between our team's Number of Cities now and our team's Number of Cities when we became the vassal of {1_TeamName}.
[COLOR_GREY]Your master may change your taxes this turn.[ENDCOLOR]
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Your master has never set taxes for you.[ENDCOLOR]

Request independence from your Master. After performing this action, your vassalage ends with {1_TeamName}.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Your Master will have the choice of accepting or refusing your request for independence. If your request is rejected, you will go to war with the other player! The chance of peaceful independence increases the stronger your are in comparison to your Master.

[COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]You cannot request independence until you have been a vassal for {1_MinimumTurns} turns. You can perform this action in {2_iNumTurns} {2_iNumTurns: plural 1?turn; other?turns;}.[ENDCOLOR]

[COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]You cannot request independence until you have met all of the required conditions for independence. Hover over the "Can Declare Independence" to view the necessary requirements for independence.[ENDCOLOR]
You are being taxed {1_Num}% of your [ICON_GOLD] Gross Gold Per Turn. You have no control over the Tax Rate {2_TeamName} sets for you. Taxes are set individually on each vassal team member.

They are receiving {1_Num} [ICON_GOLD] Gold Per Turn from you, based on {2_TaxRate}% of your {3_Num} [ICON_GOLD] Gross Gold Per Turn.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Your taxed income is calculated at the start of your turn.
Master pays 10% of Vassal's Unit Maintenance as [ICON_GOLD] Vassal Maintenance.
Master pays to the power of 0.8 of the Vassal's [ICON_CITIZEN] Population[ENDCOLOR] as [ICON_GOLD] Vassal Maintenance.
As a vassal of choice, you are relying on {1_Name} to provide protection from your lands. You do not suffer restrictions that would prevent you from leaving vassalage as capitulated vassals do.

As a capitulated vassal of {1_Name}, you are heavily restricted in your ability to declare independence. Your suffer restrictions requiring you to grow your [ICON_CITIZEN] Population and cities to become competitive with your master, or your master must have failed to protect your cities from enemy capture.
